    #!/usr/bin/env python3
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
"""
| @purpose: Build models for analysis.   
| @date: Created on Sat May 1 15:12:38 2019
| @author: Semeon Risom
| @email: semeon.risom@gmail.com
| @url: https://semeon.io/d/R33-analysis
"""
#-------global
from pdb import set_trace as breakpoint
import os, re
import datetime

#-------local
import plot, settings

#-------constants
#settings.py
console = settings.console
debug = settings.debug
stn = settings.stn

#-------rpy2
#set path
os.environ["R_HOME"] = "/Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/Current/Resources/"
from rpy2.robjects import pandas2ri, r
#from rpy2.robjects.packages import importr
#----r libraries
pandas2ri.activate()
# importr('utils', on_conflict="warn")
# importr('stats', on_conflict="warn")
# importr('base', on_conflict="warn")
# importr("dplyr", on_conflict="warn")
# importr('broom', on_conflict="warn")
# importr('broom.mixed', on_conflict="warn")
# importr('lmerTest', on_conflict="warn")
# importr('lme4', on_conflict="warn")
# importr('ggplot2', on_conflict="warn")
# importr('emmeans', on_conflict="warn")
# importr('multcomp', on_conflict="warn")

# importr('tidyverse', on_conflict="warn")
# importr('broom', on_conflict="warn")
# importr('lme4', on_conflict="warn")
# importr('lmerTest', on_conflict="warn")
# importr('ggplot2', on_conflict="warn")
# importr('emmeans', on_conflict="warn")
# importr('multcomp', on_conflict="warn")
# utils.install_packages('stargazer')
# load = '''.libPaths()'''
# load_path = r(load)

#-------Notes
# Resources:
# - https://stats.idre.ucla.edu/other/mult-pkg/whatstat/


    [docs]def anova(config, y, f, df, csv, path, is_html=True):
    """Run analysis of variance model using rpy2, seaborn and pandas.

    Parameters
    ----------
    y : :obj:`str`
        Response variable.
    f : :obj:`str`
        Formula to use for analysis.
    df : :class:`pandas.core.frame.DataFrame`
        Pandas dataframe of raw data.
    f : :obj:`str`
        R-compatiable formula.
    csv : :obj:`str`
        Name of generated CSV file to run analysis in R.
    path : :obj:`str`
        The directory path to save the generated files.
    is_html : :obj:`bool`
        Whether html should be generated.
    
    Returns
    -------
    model : :class:`rpy2.robjects.methods.RS4`
        Python representation of an R instance of class 'S4'.
    df_anova : :class:`pandas.core.frame.DataFrame`
        Pandas dataframe of model output.
    get_anova : :class:`str`
        R commands to run model.
    residuals : :class:`pandas.core.frame.DataFrame`
        Pandas dataframe of residuals.
    
    Notes
    -----
    **Resources**
        - https://rpsychologist.com/r-guide-longitudinal-lme-lmer
        - https://sites.ualberta.ca/~lkgray/uploads/7/3/6/2/7362679/slides_- anova_assumptions.pdf
        - https://rpubs.com/tmcurley/twowayanova
        - https://rstudio-pubs-static.s3.amazonaws.com/158708_78d414c091fc47bd99f6f75e3bd8f4cb.html
        - https://m-clark.github.io/docs/mixedModels/anovamixed.html
        - http://dwoll.de/rexrepos/posts/anovaMixed.html
        - https://stats.stackexchange.com/questions/247582/repeated-measures-anova-in-r-errorsubject-vs-errorsubject-day
        - https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/afex/vignettes/afex_anova_example.html#post-hoc-contrasts-and-plotting
        - http://www.let.rug.nl/nerbonne/teach/rema-stats-meth-seminar/presentations/Wieling-MixedModels-2011.pdf
    
    **Definition**
        - A test that allows one to make comparisons between the means of three or more groups of data, where two independent variables are considered. 
    
    **Assumptions of ANOVA**
        #. Normal distribution (normality)
            - Short: Samples are drawn from a normally distributed population (Q-Q Plot, Shapiro-Wilks Test)
            - Detailed Definition: Residuals in data are normally distributed.
        #. Homogeneity of variance (homoscedasticity)
            - Short: Variances are equal (or similar).
            - Detailed: Varience for a DV is constant across the sample. (residual vs fitted plot, Scale-Location plot, Levene's test)
        #. Independent observations
            - Samples have been drawn independently of each other. No analysis needed.
        
    **Hypothesis Interpretation**
        - **Null**: The means of all levels of an IV groups are equal.
        - **Alternative**: The mean of at least level of an IV is different.
    """
    #----for timestamp
    _t0 = datetime.datetime.now()
    _f = debug(message='t', source="timestamp")
    print(console['green'] + 'model.anova(%s)'%(y) + console['ENDC'])
    
    #----metadata
    source = "anova"
    #get fullname
    full = y.replace("_", " ").title()
    
    #---------check if paths exist
    for path_ in [path, path+"/csv/", path+"/img/"]:
        if not os.path.exists(path_):
            os.makedirs(path_)
    
    #---------save data for access by R
    df.to_csv(path + "/csv/" + csv, index=None)

    #---------get number of remaining subjects (datapoints) used
    subject_anova = df.drop_duplicates(subset="participant", keep="first").shape[0]
    
    #---------run r
    #code
    get_anova = '\n'.join([
        '#!/usr/bin/env Rscript3.5.1',
        'rm(list=ls());',
        '#----library',
        '# core',
        'library(tidyverse);',
        'library(broom);',
        '# analysis',
        'library(lme4); library(lmerTest);',
        '# plot',
        'library(ggplot2);',
        '# estimated marginal means',
        'library(emmeans); library(multcomp);',
        '    ',
        "#----repeated measures anova model", 
        'anova_ <- function(){',
        "    #----load data",
        '    path <- "%s"'%(path + "csv/"),
        "    df <- read.csv(file=file.path(path, '%s'), header=TRUE)"%(csv),
        '    ',
        '    #----set type',
        '    df$aoi = factor(df$aoi)',
        '    df$trialType <- factor(df$trialType)',
        '    df$cesd_group <- factor(df$cesd_group)',
        '    df$participant <- factor(df$participant)',
        '    ',
        '    #----run model',
        '    lmer_ <- lmerTest::lmer(%s, data=df)'%(f),
        '    aov_ <- stats::anova(lmer_)',
        '    ',
        '    #----Estimated Marginal Means (Least-Squares Means) of all factor levels',
        '    pair_ <- emmeans::emmeans(lmer_, c("aoi", "trialType", "cesd_group"), type = "response", adjust = "tukey")',
        '    # Comparison of Differences Between Levels of Factor',
        '    lsmeans_ <- summary(emmeans::as.glht(pairs(pair_)), test=adjusted("free")) %>% ',
        '       broom::tidy()',
        '    ',
        '    #----getting x,y coordinates for qqplot',
        '    # create plot',
        '    gg <- ggplot(lmer_) + ',
        '      ggplot2::stat_qq(aes(sample = .resid, colour = factor(trialType))) + ',
        '      ggplot2::geom_abline(linetype = "dotted")',
        '    ',
        '    # convert to tibble',
        '    gg <- ggplot_build(gg)[["data"]][[1]] %>% ',
        '      dplyr::select(sample, theoretical)',
        '    ',
        '    #----creating residuals tibble from model',
        '    # including raw data, residuals vs fitted)',
        '    # .resid=residuals, .fitted=predicted values .estimate=estimate of fixed effect',
        '    residuals <- broom::augment(lmer_) %>% ',
        '       dplyr::select(participant, trialType, dwell_time, aoi, .resid, .fitted)',
        '    ',
        '    #----merge residuals and qq tibble',
        '    residuals <- as.data.frame(merge(x=residuals, y=gg, by.x=".resid", by.y="sample", all.x = TRUE))',
        '    ',
        '    #----prepare data for export',
        '    # convert model output to tibble',
        '    output <- broom::tidy(aov_)',
        '    # convert model summary to tibble',
        '    summary <- broom::glance(lmer_)',
        '    ',
        '    #----return model output, model, residuals, lsmeans, model summary',
        '    return(list(output, lmer_, residuals, lsmeans_, summary))',
    '}'])
    # load r function
    anova_r = r(get_anova)
    # run
    df_r = anova_r()
    
    #----extract df and model from rpy2
    df_anova = df_r[0]
    model = df_r[1]
    residuals = df_r[2]
    lsmeans = df_r[3]
    summary = df_r[4]
    
    #----clean data
    #rename
    df_anova = df_anova.rename(columns={'sumsq':'SS','meansq':'MS','statistic':'z','p.value':'Pr(>|z|)'})
    # round p-value
    df_anova['Pr(>|z|)'] = df_anova[['Pr(>|z|)']].apply(lambda x: x.dropna().round(4).astype(str))
    # drop column
    df_anova = df_anova.drop(['NumDF','DenDF'], 1)
    #rename columns
    df_anova = df_anova.rename_axis("index", axis="columns")
    
    #----format summary
    summary = summary.rename_axis("index", axis="columns")
    summary = summary.to_html(index=True, index_names=True).replace('<table border="1" class="dataframe">',
    '<table id="table1" class="table '+source+' table-striped table-bordered hover dt-responsive nowrap"\ cellspacing="0" width="100%">')
    
    #---------title, footnote, results
    title = '<b>Table 1.</b> Repeated Measures ANOVA for %s (N = %s).'%(full, subject_anova)
    description = ''.join([
        "<p><b>Type III Analysis of Variance Table with Satterthwaite's method</b> \
        [<a class='anchor', href='https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/stats/versions/3.5.3/topics/anova'>anova</a>]. ",
        "This table summarizes effects on gaze dwell time with CESD score, areas of interest, and stimulus.</p>",
        "<div class='paragraph'>",
            "<div>The assumptions for the model are:</div>",
            '<ul class="number-list">',
                '<li>%s (<a href="#qq" class="anchor">Q-Q Plot</a>).</li>'%(config['def']['nd']),
                "<li>%s (<a href='#rf' class='anchor'>Residual vs Fitted Plot</a>).</li>"%(config['def']['hv']),
                '<li>%s </li>'%(config['def']['io']),
            '</ul>',
        '</div>'
        "<div class='paragraph'>",
            "<div>The following post-hoc analysis were run:</div>",
            '<ul class="number-list">',
                '<li><a href="#lsmean" class="anchor">Estimated Marginal Means</a> (<a href="#boxplot" class="anchor">plot</a>)</li>',
                '<li><a href="#qq" class="anchor">Q-Q Plot</a>.</li>',
                "<li><a href='#rf' class='anchor'>Residual vs Fitted Plot</a>.</li>",
            '</ul>',
        '</div>'
    ])
    results = ' '.join([
        "<p>",
        config['def']['exclude'],
        "The resulting data were analysed by fitting a repeated measures ANOVA in 'R', using the stats::anova \
        function (%s)."%(config['def']['anova']),
        "The dependent variable was gaze time (msec) within an area of interest. "
        "The random effect was particpant.",
        "The fixed effects were %s,"%(config['def']['cesd_group']),
        "area of interest (within subjects; sad image, neutral image),",
        "and stimulus (within subjects; %s, %s)."%(config['def']['iaps'], config['def']['pofa']),
        "</p>"
    ])
    # combine
    footnote = summary + re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', description + results).strip()
    #----create script
    script = ['<div class="code-container" style="display: none">' + '\n',
                '<pre class="line-numbers">' + '\n',
                    '<code class="lang-r">' + '\n',
                        '%s'%(get_anova) + '\n',
                    '</code>' + '\n',
                '</pre>' + '\n',
            '</div>\n']
    script = ''.join(script)
    
    #----plots and tables
    #lsmeans table
    #https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/afex/vignettes/afex_anova_example.html
    try:         
        lsmeans = lsmeans.drop(['rhs'], 1)
        lsmeans['p.value'] = lsmeans[['p.value']].apply(lambda x: x.dropna().round(4).astype(str))
        lsmeans = lsmeans.rename_axis("index", axis="columns")
        lsmeans = lsmeans.rename(columns={'lhs':'Contrasts (valence, trialType, cesd)','std.error':'SE','statistic':'t','p.value':'Pr(>|t|)'})
    except:
        pass
    #create
    html_plots = []
    title_ = '<b>Table 2.</b> Pairwise Comparisons of Estimated Marginal Means.'
    footnote_ = config['def']['emm']
    html_plots.append({"title":title_,"footnote":footnote_,"anchor":"lsmean",'type':'table','df':lsmeans})
                
    #boxplot
    file = "%s_boxplot.png"%(y)
    path_ = path + "/img/" + file
    title_="Pairwise Comparisons Plot (<a class='cat iaps'>neutral</a>, <a class='cat pofa'>sad</a>)."
    footnote_ = 'This boxplot provides a comparison of aoi dwell time (msec) for both neutral and sad images \
    and across both IAPS and POFA image inventories. Both IAPS and POFA plots were nornalized to allow direct comparison.'
    html_plots.append({"title":title_,"file":"%s"%(file),"footnote":footnote_, "anchor":"boxplot", 'type':'plot'})
    plot.boxplot(config=config, df=residuals, path=path_, x='aoi', y=y, cat='dwell')
    
    #probability (QQ) plot
    file = "%s_qq.png"%(y)
    path_ = path + "/img/" + file
    title_="Q-Q Plot (<a class='cat iaps'>iaps</a>, <a class='cat pofa'>pofa</a>)."
    footnote_ = config['def']['qq']
    html_plots.append({"title":title_,"file":"%s"%(file),"footnote":footnote_, "anchor":"qq", 'type':'plot'})
    plot.qq_plot_r(config=config, y=y, residuals=residuals, path=path_)
    
    #residuals vs fitted plot
    file = "%s_residuals.png"%(y)
    path_ = path + "/img/" + file
    title_="Residuals vs Fitted Plot (<a class='cat iaps'>iaps</a>, <a class='cat pofa'>pofa</a>)."
    footnote_ = config['def']['rvf']
    html_plots.append({"title":title_,"file":"%s"%(file),"footnote":footnote_, "anchor":"rf", 'type':'plot'})
    plot.residual_plot_r(config=config, y=y, residuals=residuals, path=path_)
    
    #save model and plot
    ##create html
    if is_html:
        path_ = path + '%s.html'%(y)
        plot.html(config=config, df=df_anova, raw_data=df, path=path_, source=source, title=title, name=y,
                            script=script, plots=html_plots, footnote=footnote)
    #----end
    print(console['blue']+'%s finished in %s msec'%(_f,((datetime.datetime.now()-_t0).total_seconds()*1000))+console['ENDC'])
    return model, df_anova, get_anova, residuals
    
  

    [docs]def lmer(config, y, f, df, exclude, csv, path, is_html=True):
    """Run linear mixed regression model, using rpy2, seaborn and pandas.

    Parameters
    ----------
    y : :obj:`str`
        Response variable.
    f : :obj:`list` of :obj:`str`
        Formula to use for analysis.
    df : :class:`pandas.core.frame.DataFrame`
        Pandas dataframe of raw data.
    f : :obj:`str`
        R-compatiable formula.
    exclude : :obj:`list`
        List of participants to be excluded.
    csv : :obj:`str`
        Name of generated CSV file to run analysis in R.
    path : :obj:`str`
        The directory path to save the generated files.
    is_html : :obj:`bool`
        Whether html should be generated.
        
    Notes
    -----
    **Resources**
        - https://rpsychologist.com/r-guide-longitudinal-lme-lmer
        - https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47686227/poisson-regression-in-statsmodels-and-r
        - https://tsmatz.wordpress.com/2017/08/30/glm-regression-logistic-poisson-gaussian-gamma-tutorial-with-r/
        - https://stats.stackexchange.com/questions/311556/help-interpreting-count-data-glmm-using-lme4-glmer-and-glmer-nb-negative-binom
    """
    #----for timestamp
    _t0 = datetime.datetime.now()
    _f = debug(message='t', source="timestamp")
    print(console['green'] + 'model.lmer(%s)'%(y) + console['ENDC'])
    
    #----metadata
    source = 'onset'
    
    #-----exclude participants
    df_ex = df[~df['participant'].isin(exclude)]
    
    #----check if paths exist
    for path_ in [path, path + "csv/", path+"/img/"]:
        if not os.path.exists(path_):
            os.makedirs(path_)
    
    #----save data for access by R
    df_ex.to_csv(path + "csv/" + csv, index=None)
        
    #----get number of remaining subjects (datapoints) used
    subject_poisson = df_ex.drop_duplicates(subset="participant", keep="first").shape[0]
    
    #----run r
    #code
    get_lmer = '\n'.join([
        '#!/usr/bin/env Rscript3.5.1',
        'rm(list=ls());',
        '#----library',
        '# core',
        'library(tidyverse);',
        'library(broom); library(broom.mixed);',
        '# analysis',
        'library(lme4); library(lmerTest);',
        '# plot',
        'library(ggplot2);',
        '# estimated marginal means',
        'library(emmeans); library(multcomp);',
        '    ',
        "#----linear mixed model", 
        'lmer_ <- function(){',
        "    #----load data",
        '    path <- "%s"'%(path + "csv/"),
        "    df <- read.csv(file=file.path(path, '%s'), header=TRUE)"%(csv),
        '    ',
        '    #----drop data',
        '    # os #samples too small',
        '    df <- df[(!df$os=="cos"),]',
        '    ',
        '    #----normalize trial to [0,1] (recommended by Jason)',
        '    df$TrialNum <- lapply(df$TrialNum, function(x){((x - 0)/(197 - 0))})',
        '    ',
        '    #----set type', 
        '    # set as factor',
        "    df$os <- factor(df$os)",
        "    df$trialType <- factor(df$trialType)",
        '    df$participant <- factor(df$participant)',
        '    # set trial as numeric (recommended by Jason)',
        '    df$TrialNum <- as.numeric(df$TrialNum)',
        '    ',      
        '    #----run model',
        '    model <- lmerTest::lmer(%s, data=df)'%(f),
        '    ',
        '    #----prepare data for export',
        '    # convert output to tibble',
        '    output <- broom.mixed::tidy(model)',
        '    # convert summary to tibble',
        '    summary <- broom.mixed::glance(model)',
        '    ',
        '    #----return output, model, and model summary',
        '    return(list(output, model, summary))',
    '}'])
    #load r function
    lmer_r = r(get_lmer)
    #run
    df_r = lmer_r()
    
    #----extract df, model, summary from rpy2
    df_lmer = df_r[0]
    model = df_r[1]
    summary = df_r[2]
    
    #----clean data
    #rename
    df_lmer = df_lmer.rename(columns={'estimate':'B','std.error':'SE','statistic':'t','p.value':'Pr(>|t|)'})
    # round p-value
    df_lmer['Pr(>|t|)'] = df_lmer[['Pr(>|t|)']].apply(lambda x: x.dropna().round(4).astype(str))
    # drop column
    df_lmer = df_lmer.drop(['group','effect'], 1)
    # drop row if it contains intercepts
    drop = ['sd__(Intercept)','	sd__TrialNum','cor__(Intercept).TrialNum','sd__Observation','sd__TrialNum']
    df_lmer = df_lmer[~df_lmer['term'].isin(drop)]
    #rename columns
    df_lmer = df_lmer.rename_axis("index", axis="columns")
    
    #----format summary
    summary = summary.rename_axis("index", axis="columns")
    summary = summary.to_html(index=True, index_names=True).replace('<table border="1" class="dataframe">',
    '<table id="table2" class="table '+source+' table-striped table-bordered hover dt-responsive nowrap"\ cellspacing="0" width="100%">')
    
    #----title, description, and results
    t_ = "Stimulus Onset Error" if y == 'diff_stim' else "DotLoc Onset Error"
    title = '<b>Table 1.</b> Linear Mixed Model Regression for %s (N = %s).'%(t_, subject_poisson)
    description = ''.join([
        "<p><b>Linear Mixed Model Fit by REML (Laplace Approximation)</b> \
        [<a class='anchor', href='https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/lme4/versions/1.1-21/topics/lmer'>lmer</a>]. ",
        "This table summarizes effects on onset error rate with trial number, operating system, and stimulus.</p>",
        "<div class='paragraph'>",
            "<div>The assumptions for the model are:</div>",
            '<ul class="number-list">',
                '<li>%s (<a href="#qq" class="anchor">Q-Q Plot</a>).</li>'%(config['def']['nd']),
                "<li>%s (<a href='#rf' class='anchor'>Residual vs Fitted Plot</a>).</li>"%(config['def']['hv']),
                '<li>%s </li>'%(config['def']['io']),
            '</ul>',
        '</div>'
        "<div class='paragraph'>",
            "<div>The following post-hoc analysis were run:</div>",
            '<ul class="number-list">',
                '<li><a href="#lsmean" class="anchor">Estimated Marginal Means</a> (<a href="#boxplot" class="anchor">plot</a>)</li>',
                '<li><a href="#qq" class="anchor">Q-Q Plot</a>.</li>',
                "<li><a href='#rf' class='anchor'>Residual vs Fitted Plot</a>.</li>",
            '</ul>',
        '</div>'
    ])
    results = ' '.join([
        "<p>",
        config['def']['exclude'],
        "The resulting data were analysed by fitting a linear mixed model regression in 'R', using the lme4::lmer \
        function (%s)."%(config['def']['lmer']),
        "The dependent variable was onset error rate. "
        "The random effect were trial and particpant.",
        "The fixed effects were operating system (between subjects; Microsoft Windows, MacOS)",
        "stimulus (within subjects; %s, %s),"%(config['def']['iaps'], config['def']['pofa']),
        "and trial (within subjects; 0-197).",
        "</p>"
    ])
    # combine
    footnote = summary + re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', description + results).strip()
    
    #---------plots
    #build plots
    plots = {}
    
    #---individual trend line
    clip = 250 if y=='diff_dotloc' else 200
    plots['individual'] = {}
    plots['individual']['type'] = 'plot'
    plots['individual']['file'] = '%s_individual'%(y)
    plots['individual']['path'] = path + "/img/" + "%s.png"%(plots['individual']['file'])
    plots['individual']['title'] = "Individual Trend Plot of the Difference Between Expected and True Onset Time \
    for '%s' (nested by subject:trial, window=5)."%(t_)
    plots['individual']['footnote'] = "Each individual subjects individual trend is indicated here. \
    Participants with 'Dotloc' or 'Stimulus' onset error rate 3 SD above the median are indicated here with a semi-opaque line. \
    The graph has been clipped at y=%s for displaying purposes."%(clip)
    #---group trend plot
    plots['group'] = {}
    #---binned
    plots['group']["binned"] = {"bins":33,"ptype":'diff'}
    #---unbinned
    plots['group']["unbinned"] = {"bins":None,"ptype":'diff'}
    #both
    plots['group']['type'] = 'plot'
    plots['group']['file'] = '%s_group'%(y)
    plots['group']['path'] = path + "/img/" + "%s.png"%(plots['group']['file'])
    plots['group']['title'] = "Trend Plot of the Difference Between Expected and True Onset Time \
    for %s (nested by subject:trial)."%(t_)
    plots['group']['footnote'] = "Data is either unbinned (c,d) or binned into %s discrete evenly-sized groups (a,b). \
    The model is still fit using the original data. No participants have been excluded for this analysis. \
    The binned graph has been clipped at y=1000 for displaying purposes."%(plots['group']["binned"]['bins'])
    
    #---run
    #rename
    df = df.rename(columns={'onset>500':'onset_greater'})
    html_plots = plot.onset_diff_plot(config=config, df=df, meta=plots, drop=exclude, y=y, clip=clip)
    
    #---create script
    script = ['<div class="code-container" style="display: none">'+'\n',
                '<pre class="line-numbers">'+'\n',
                    '<code class="lang-r">'+'\n',
                       '%s\n'%(get_lmer),
                    '</code>'+'\n',
                '</pre>'+'\n',
            '</div>'+'\n']
    script = ''.join(script)
    
    #--------------------html
    if is_html:
        html_name = '%s_error'%(y)
        path_ = path + "%s.html"%(html_name)
        plot.html(config=config, df=df_lmer, raw_data=df, path=path_, source=source, title=title, name=html_name,
                  script=script, plots=html_plots, footnote=footnote)
    #----end
    print(console['blue']+'%s finished in %s msec'%(_f,((datetime.datetime.now()-_t0).total_seconds()*1000))+console['ENDC'])
    return model, df_lmer, get_lmer
    


    [docs]def logistic(config, y, f, df, me, exclude, csv, path, is_html=True):
    """Run logistic regression model, using rpy2, seaborn and pandas.

    Parameters
    ----------
    y : :obj:`str`
        Response variable.
    f : :obj:`str`
        Formula to use for analysis.
    df : :class:`pandas.core.frame.DataFrame`
        Pandas dataframe of raw data.
    me : :obj:`list` of :obj:`str`
        List of main effects.
    exclude : :obj:`list`
        List of participants to be excluded.
    csv : :obj:`str`
        Name of generated CSV file to run analysis in R.
    path : :obj:`str`
        The directory path to save the generated files.
    is_html : :obj:`bool`
        Whether html should be generated.
        
    Returns
    -------
    model : :class:`rpy2.robjects.methods.RS4`
        Python representation of an R instance of class 'S4'.
    df_logit : :class:`pandas.core.frame.DataFrame`
        Pandas dataframe of model output.
    get_logit : :class:`str`
        R commands to run model.
    residuals : :class:`pandas.core.frame.DataFrame`
        Pandas dataframe of residuals.
        
    Notes
    -----
    **Resources**
        - https://rpsychologist.com/r-guide-longitudinal-lme-lmer
        - https://stats.idre.ucla.edu/other/mult-pkg/whatstat/
        - http://www.sthda.com/english/articles/36-classification-methods-essentials/148-logistic-regression-assumptions-and-diagnostics-in-r/
        - https://www.statisticssolutions.com/assumptions-of-logistic-regression/
        - https://tsmatz.wordpress.com/2017/08/30/glm-regression-logistic-poisson-gaussian-gamma-tutorial-with-r/
        - https://data.library.virginia.edu/diagnostic-plots/
    """
    #----for timestamp
    _t0 = datetime.datetime.now()
    _f = debug(message='t', source="timestamp")
    print(console['green'] + 'model.logistic(%s)'%(y) + console['ENDC'])
    
    #----metadata
    source = 'logit'
    #get fullname
    full = y.replace("_", " ").title().replace("Cesd", "CESD")
    
    #-----exclude participants
    df = df[~df['participant'].isin(exclude)]
    
    #---------check if paths exist
    for path_ in [path, path+"/csv/", path+"/img/"]:
        if not os.path.exists(path_):
            os.makedirs(path_)
    
    #---------save data for access by R
    df.to_csv(path + "/csv/" + csv, index=None)
    
    #-------get number of remaining subjects (datapoints) used
    subjects_logit = df.drop_duplicates(subset="participant", keep="first").shape[0]
    
    #-------model
    #f = 'factor(cesd_group) ~ dp_bias + gaze_bias + final_gaze_bias + (1|participant)'
    f = 'glmer(%s, \n\
               family=binomial(link="logit"), data=df, nAGQ=0)'%(f)
    
    #-------logit and confidence intervals to R data.frame
    ##note: confidence intervals are based on the profiled log-likelihood function
    get_logit = '\n'.join([
        '#!/usr/bin/env Rscript3.5.1',
        'rm(list=ls());',
        '#----library',
        '# core',
        'library(tidyverse);',
        'library(broom);',
        '# analysis',
        'library(lme4);',
        '# plot',
        'library(ggplot2);',
        '# estimated marginal means',
        'library(emmeans); library(multcomp);',
        '    ',
        '#----generalized linear mixed model',
        'logit_ <- function(){',
        "    #----load data",
        '    path <- "%s"'%(path + "csv/"),
        "    df <- read.csv(file=file.path(path, '%s'), header=TRUE)"%(csv),
        '    ',
        '    #----normalize trial to [0,1] (recommended by Jason)',
        '    df$TrialNum <- lapply(df$TrialNum, function(x){((x - 0)/(197 - 0))})',
        '    ',
        '    #----set type', 
        '    # set as factor',
        "    df$os <- factor(df$os)",
        "    df$trialType <- factor(df$trialType)",
        '    df$participant <- factor(df$participant)',
        '    # set trial as numeric (recommended by Jason)',
        '    df$TrialNum <- as.numeric(df$TrialNum)',
        '    ',
        '    #----run model',
        '    model <- %s'%(f),
        '    ',
        '    #----confidence interval',
        '    ci <- as.data.frame.matrix(round(confint(model, method="Wald"),3)) %>% ',
        '      cbind(term = rownames(.), .)',
        '    rownames(ci) <- 1:nrow(ci)',
        '    ',
        '    #----getting x,y coordinates for qqplot',
        '    # create plot',
        '    gg <- ggplot(model) + ',
        '      ggplot2::stat_qq(aes(sample = .resid, colour = factor(trialType))) + ',
        '      ggplot2::geom_abline(linetype = "dotted") + ',
        '      theme_bw()',
        '    # convert to tibble',
        '    gg <- ggplot_build(gg)[["data"]][[1]] %>% ',
        '      dplyr::select(sample, theoretical)',
        '    ',
        '    #----creating residuals tibbles from model',
        '    # including raw data, residuals vs fitted',
        '    # .resid=residuals, .fitted=predicted values .estimate=estimate of fixed effect',
        '    residuals <- broom::augment(model) %>% ',
        '       dplyr::select(participant, trialType, cesd_group, .resid, .fitted)',
        '    ',
        '    #----merge residuals and qq tibbles',
        '    residuals <- merge(x=residuals, y=gg, by.x=".resid", by.y="sample", all.x = TRUE)',
        '    ',
        '    #----prepare data for export',
        '    # convert model to tibble',
        '    output <- broom::tidy(model)',
        '    # convert summary to tibble',
        '    summary <- broom::glance(model)',
        '    ',
        '    #----merge output with confidence intervals',
        '    output <- merge(x=output, y=ci, by.x="term", by.y="term", all.x = TRUE, sort = FALSE)',
        '    ',
        '    #----return model output, model, residuals, model summary',
        '    return(list(output, model, residuals, summary))',
    '}'])
        
    #----run r code
    #load r function
    logit_r = r(get_logit)
    #run
    df_r = logit_r()
    
    #----extract model dataframe, model, and residuals dataframe from rpy2
    df_logit = df_r[0]
    model = df_r[1]
    residuals = df_r[2]
    summary = df_r[3]
    
    #----clean data
    #rename
    df_logit = df_logit.rename(columns={'estimate':'B','std.error':'SE','statistic':'z','p.value':'Pr(>|z|)'})
    # round p-value
    df_logit['Pr(>|z|)'] = df_logit[['Pr(>|z|)']].apply(lambda x: x.dropna().round(4).astype(str))
    # drop column
    df_logit = df_logit.drop(['group','effect'], 1)
    # drop row if it contains intercepts
    drop = ['sd_(Intercept).participant','sd_TrialNum.participant','cor_(Intercept).TrialNum.participant',
            'sd__(Intercept)','sd__TrialNum','cor__(Intercept).TrialNum']
    df_logit = df_logit[~df_logit['term'].isin(drop)]
    
    #rename columns
    df_logit = df_logit.rename_axis("index", axis="columns")
    
    #----format summary
    summary = summary.rename_axis("index", axis="columns")
    summary = summary.to_html(index=True, index_names=True).replace('<table border="1" class="dataframe">',
    '<table id="table2" class="table '+source+' table-striped table-bordered hover dt-responsive nowrap"\ cellspacing="0" width="100%">')

    #-------title, footnote, and results
    title = '<b>Table 1.</b> Generalized Linear Mixed Model Regression for %s (N = %s).'%(full, subjects_logit)
    #description
    description = ''.join([
        "<p><b>Generalized Linear Mixed Model Fit by Maximum Likelihood (Adaptive Gauss-Hermite Quadrature)</b> \
        [<a class='anchor', href='https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/lme4/versions/1.1-21/topics/glmer'>glmer</a>]. ",
        "This table summarizes effects on CESD score with trial number, bias score, and stimulus.</p>",
        "<div class='paragraph'>",
            "<div>The assumptions for the model are:</div>",
            '<ul class="number-list">',
                '<li>%s (<a href="#qq" class="anchor">Q-Q Plot</a>).</li>'%(config['def']['nd']),
                "<li>%s (<a href='#rf' class='anchor'>Residual vs Fitted Plot</a>).</li>"%(config['def']['hv']),
                '<li>%s </li>'%(config['def']['io']),
            '</ul>',
        '</div>'
        "<div class='paragraph'>",
            "<div>The following post-hoc analysis were run:</div>",
            '<ul class="number-list">',
                '<li><a href="#qq" class="anchor">Q-Q Plot</a>.</li>',
                "<li><a href='#rf' class='anchor'>Residual vs Fitted Plot</a>.</li>",
            '</ul>',
        '</div>'
    ])
    #results
    terms = ['bias score','stimulus','trial number']
    results = [
        "The resulting data were analysed by fitting mixed effects logistic regression models in 'R', using the glmer \
        function (%s)."%(config['def']['lmer']),
        "The dependent variable was a binary measure of CESD score ('Low' (<16) and 'High' (16))."
        "The random effects were: trial and particpant.",
        "The fixed effects were: %s score (within subjects),"%(me[0].replace("_", " ")),
        "trial (within subjects; 0-197),",
        "and stimulus (within subjects; %s, %s)."%(config['def']['iaps'], config['def']['pofa']),
        "Weights were applied to the model to correct for the validity of bias score per trial."
    ]
    ## main effects
    for idx, effect in enumerate(me):
        #get row
        row = df_logit[df_logit['term'].str.contains(effect)]
        #get term, B, se, z, p
        term = terms[idx]
        b = stn(row['B'].values[0])
        se = stn(row['SE'].values[0])
        z = stn(row['z'].values[0])
        p = stn(row['Pr(>|z|)'].values[0])
        #append
        #if first item
        if idx == 0:
            results.append('No main effect was found for %s (b=%s, z=%s, p=%s)'%(term,b,z,p))
        else:
            results.append(', %s (b=%s, z=%s, p=%s).'%(term,b,z,p))
            
    results = '<p>' + ' '.join(results) + '</p>'
    
    #combine all
    footnote = re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', summary + description + results).strip()
    
    #----prepare script for html
    script = ['<div class="code-container" style="display: none">'+'\n',
                '<pre class="line-numbers">'+'\n',
                    '<code class="lang-r">'+'\n',
                       '%s\n'%(get_logit),
                    '</code>'+'\n',
                '</pre>'+'\n',
            '</div>'+'\n']
    script = ''.join(script)
    
    #----allows seaborn to be run if matplotlib has already been loaded
    os.environ['KMP_DUPLICATE_LIB_OK']='True'
    
    #----plots
    html_plots = []
    #probability (QQ) plot
    file = "%s_qq.png"%(y)
    path_ = path + "/img/" + file
    title_="Q-Q Plot for CESD Group (<a class='cat iaps'>iaps</a>, <a class='cat pofa'>pofa</a>)."
    footnote_ = config['def']['qq']
    html_plots.append({"title":title_,"file":"%s"%(file),"footnote":footnote_, "anchor":"qq"})
    plot.qq_plot_r(config=config, y=y, residuals=residuals, path=path_)
    
    #residuals vs fitted plot
    file = "%s_residuals.png"%(y)
    path_ = path + "/img/" + file
    title_="Residuals vs Fitted for CESD Group (<a class='cat iaps'>iaps</a>, <a class='cat pofa'>pofa</a>)."
    footnote_ = config['def']['rvf']
    html_plots.append({"title":title_,"file":"%s"%(file),"footnote":footnote_, "anchor":"rf"})
    plot.residual_plot_r(config=config, y=y, residuals=residuals, path=path_)
        
    #-------------------------------------------------save model and plot
    #save model and plot
    ##create html
    if is_html:
        path_ = path + '/%s.html'%(y)
        plot.html(config=config, df=df_logit, raw_data=df, path=path_, source=source, plots=html_plots, name=y, 
                  title=title, footnote=footnote, script=script)        
    #----end
    print(console['blue']+'%s finished in %s msec'%(_f,((datetime.datetime.now()-_t0).total_seconds()*1000))+console['ENDC'])
    return model, df_logit, get_logit, residuals
